[u] 11/10 would recommend [/u]

This game has everything one would want. You want to get drunk together with the local yokel? We got that. You want to go flying out of a corner at 90+ KPH with your Cousin? We got that too! You want to build a reliable car that will get you anywhere? We.... don't got that....
BUT you CAN build a shitbox that'll fart it's pistons out whilst you're cruising on the highway (or being chased by cops).

Learn Finnish. Get Drunk. Build a car. Then get this game and do it all over again!

literally anything can happen in this game. i pissed on my tv and fuckin exploded, i drive my motercycle without a helmet and a bee blinds me, i commit vehicular manslauhter and the police show up at my door. oh yeah and you can build cars üëç

First i was like, what the hell is this shitty game.. but then i was like, Saatana!
It is hard, unforgiving, crazy and funny at the same time. It looks empty, but do not get fooled. The feeling when your car starts for the first time and then it catches on fire, cause you forgot oil and coolant, just perfect. And yes, you can burn your house the hell down... Best hours of self torture spent in game in 2025 for me... 11/10
Oh, i need to add: When playing, i feel that someone really lived this in 1995. Good old times ;)

As a guy who doesn't own a car, this game is like a dream that has never been achieved. Before playing, I knew this game was something about building a car and competing in rally. What I didn't expect is realistic survival as a teenager in 1995 Suomi Finland. What kind of car game is this where you can even go to JAIL for not paying fines?!

Not gonna spoil too much, but all I'm saying is that car parts ain't cheap, so you have to work hard in order to afford them ‚Äî and boy-o-boy, there are plenty of side jobs the game has to offer. From simple groceries for grandma or advert delivery to pumping sewage tanks or operating heavy-duty farming machinery.

It's crazy how simple the game looks, yet how complex it actually is and how much attention to detail it has ‚Äî from troubleshooting during car assembly to the electric meter that calculates the amount of electricity differently depending on whether the lights are on in the rooms or not.

For $7 it has more content than most AAA games these days. Best regards to the developer, ToplessGun ‚Äî it was the most fun summer I've ever had. 400 hours in and more to go. Can't wait for My Winter Car, hope it comes out at the end of this year.
A outstanding game that is really cool and fun. Explore finland in 1995 and do what ever you want with real finnish voice actors too!
If you feel like torturing yourself for a ton of time and randomly dying from your drunk cousin hitting you of to death then this is just the game for you 10/10 would recommend
Really good life simulator for the Finnish living experience. Also make car.
The best car mechanic game ever! Now Im just waiting for the next journey in My Winer Car

This is a Finnish psychological experiment
This game will make you question your mental state, it will make you rage quit and came back and starve while accidentally set yourself on fire, even a wrench feels like skyrim boss while the bugs live with you and not paying a single dime on rent.

This blender having a mid life crisiss called "car" shakes like it's trying to summon a demon but forgot the correct Latin and somehow manage to summon that demon in morse code.

That retail reptile named Teimo is looking at you like every second cost him life points while talking to you, let's do not talk about the cousin the game, the brake fluid drinker, every ride with that "person" feels like a death wish.

11/10 game

I'm writing this review to earn the Steam Awards badge, but this game isn‚Äôt bad, you know.

I still remember the dread I felt after spending real-world hours building my first car, only to take it on its maiden trip and, minutes later, get into a tragic accident. Neither the car nor I survived, and, as the cherry on top, the save got deleted upon death :D

10/10

Do i love this game? Yes

Do i suck at the game? Also Yes

Would i recommend this to anyone i know or dont? Sure why not

Did my satsuma turned into lego after trying to take a *gentle* right turn? Indeed it did..
Built the engine, drove for 5 minutes, head gasket blew up, bought a crate of beer and drank it, went home, booted My Summer Car. 10/10 game.

The game is enjoyable, however you're going to need to look up how half the things work along with how to put them together and the other half only ever have a less than optimal understanding of. that being said there are cons to the game:

1; The driving could use some work for keyboard and mouse but you can just get a cheap logi-tech wheel and pedals to fix that.
2: Its carpal tunnel heaven, you need to tighten every bolt individually and that can just get painful after 10 ish min
3: The only full sized vehicle to take to town to get all the supplies you need for the car is a tracker that takes 20 to 25 minutes to get to town in so your in that thing of about an hour

The only reason that I recommend this game is because I enjoy personal pain and suffering coupled with my love for cars and rally. Overall 8.5/10 could use some power drills for you garage to speed up some parts of the build that ae needlessly long
My summer car is really just the Normal finnish countryside game. it can be really frustrating when you cant get the satsuma running but is also really rewarding once you get satsuma up and running.

There are two moods playing this game: https://youtu.be/kaqeizvxefM?si=tcKLk-TkIkbJq9uU and https://youtu.be/b0ZMauqib7Q?si=VwJZhFaSBr1hiJnt

200/10 Very recommend. Play this game if you car.

The year of our lord 2025 blesses us with My Summer car officially and so it is the duty of all strong finnish boys to sign a positive review for the greatest game of generations to come.

Unironically some of the most immersive gameplay you'll ever find. You are a strong finnish boy out in the middle of Finland(nowhere) and you have to learn how to survive as one. You can just bum out your days drinking beer and eating sausigs but if you don't run(lol) to the store and buy more or you'll die of starvation or thirst. Don't forget to pay bills or you wont have running water or a tv to piss on.

The game is actually a long list of shit you HAVE to do if you want to live so it's less of a game and more of chore but it's one you'll either love or hate. It's not perfect though you can't use a beercrate to carry items but I'll still nominate it for every category I can so it can win all the accolades it deserves.

This game may look easy but instead its a rage simulator because your car could run fine one time but he next you can lose your engine 

8/10 recommend
Trying to decide if building the engine is peaceful or makes me want to throw my monitor off the second story balcony. I enjoy the game though and its interesting lore.

Find game.
Check wallet.
Buy game.
Wait for transaction.
Open library.
Find game.
Download game.
Wait for download.
Download complete.
Open game.
Get your ears blown from the music.
Lower the volume.
Pick your color.
Start new game.
You close game because you want an image on your ID.
Figure out how the hell you do it.
Open YouTube.
Search "how to get custom image id on my summer car".
Watch tutorial.
Still don't understand it.
Give up.
Open MSC again.
Get once again earraped.
Start a new game (again).
Give yourself a "Finnish" name (its actually just "saatana perkele" ).
Start the game.
Get born.
Fix the settings.
Go to the car.
Open the garage.
Starts swearing for a whole minute because you thought the game was going to be easy...
Try for 20 minutes.
Give up and find a tutorial.
Watch for 5 minutes and close YouTube.
Go back to the game.
Realize you're hungry.
Go to the house.
Check note on fridge.
Fuck that note.
Open fridge.
Find food only for one day.
*Sigh*
Take the ES Jonnez.
Learn to drive it.
Start it up.
Crash.
Get back up.
Crash again.
And again.
And again.
And again.
And again.
And again.
And again.
And again.
Get to the main road.
Try and find Teimo's shop.
Get to the town.
Find Teimo.
Buy shit.
No money left.
Too late.
You died.
Spawn back at cemetery.
Go to Teimo again.
Piss on him.
Get yelled at.
Swear at him.
Go find your cousin for a ride.
He arrives.
Get in car.
Be calm.
...
...
...
Start swearing relentlessly.
He starts to speed up.
Car goes 110 km/h.
Crash.
You died.
*Alt + F4*
Go to Steam.
Uninstall game.
Post review about how shitty the game is.
Refund the game.
Be happy again.
Moral of the story is...
DONT FUCKING BUY THIS GAME!!!

Very cool, love the style and gameplay. But you have to invest a lot of time.

...and despair.

what is there to say about this masterpiece of a game?

We start off in a Northern country not like any. Possibily one of those countries where it gets cold during winter, but. if you're good at reading, A congratulations, B how else did you get this far through the review? if someone's reading for you you're cheating and must do 10 pushups. anyhow, if you're good at reading AND ONLY IF you're good at reading and context, you will recognize that the title of the game is my SUMMER car, therefore, the game isn't set during WINTER, otherwise it would be called my WINTER car.

Now, i've done plenty of mistakes, and right there, above i have made quite the big mistake that can be never forgiven. I've called this a game. This piece of fiction is like no other, it will take you through a journey of emotions and pure unbottled adrenaline in like, 24 hours or something, yesterday i learnt clocks have hands and apparently the 24 hour format is favoured by many and enjoyed even by the former television star Julia Pogrebinska, who would probably also tell you to play this masterpiece, she's got good taste.

Anyhow, you start off with a cutscene that explains the birds and the bees, which to be strictly scientific, have nothing to do with what they're used to set an example for, but hey, i don't make the rules, i don't follow them either. And you get out of what seems to be a very narrow hole, on the back of a car, which is driving, at this point you'll notice 2 things, You probably didn't hit your soft spot (good) or you hit your soft spot (very bad)

Once you are done remembering that coming out of your parental figure isn't even the beginning of what life holds for you, you're ready to live life in FINLAND (i think, i'm not a GPS system) during SUMMER! so, to start off, the weather is rich, rich with wasps, because the pricks will do just about anything in their power to turn you into a colander. (buy DDT when you have it)

Other than the wasps being your sworn enemy, you have a couple of things you need to care for, Dirtyness (if it gets too low you have to play either warzone or league of legends, resulting in the following loss of life of the player character.) Pee meter, which reminds you that bladders are a very real thing, even though pee is stored in the testes (checkmate pee deniers), and hunger and thirst.

Hunger is a lovely throwback to far cry 2, because, far cry 2 was rich with food (and jammed guns) in it's african context, while, Finland, is more akin to a barren land where the only source of nourishment is the bearded gnome behind the counter also known as Teimo, and no you don't have to eat him, you have to buy food from him.

Thirst? well, thirst is often known as the silent killer, aka Agent 47, but, to scare it away, it's pretty easy, just stay hydrated, also known as making out with the nearest faucet, and no before you ask, you can't drink gasoline and not expect consequences, i,e. the awesome everlasting taste.

There's also stress, which is supposed to remind you how it feels to be a "professional" counter strike player and being one wrong eco round out of your house and under a wonderful bridge, now known to you as home, enjoy it bucko. Anyhow, when stress goes all the way up you die, and you know what, well earned, because you DIDN'T SMOKE MARLBORO REDS, like, what are you doing? philip morris only cares for you! and that's what you need the ciggies for, to keep stress at bay and possibly not dying from an aneurysm, which i could be having as i'm thinking too much when typing this. And you can also swear like the average person when stressed too i guess, just remember to draw the right keystroke out of the million keybinds there are in the game.

so we've gone over the SURVIVAL mechanics of the experience, yes that's right YOU SURVIVE in Finland, you don't LIVE, you don't THRIVE, you SURVIVE. it's a struggle everyday and this art piece lets you remember that every ticking second.

If you weren't amused by the game mechanics that remember your frail vitality, then the next game mechanic is for you, the game has JOBS! that's right, the best part is, they are very hard to obtain. Except for picking strawberries, which pays as you would've expected, just enough to remember you can either accept your miserable life or, indulge in the sweet escapism of the cigarettes that you can buy from Teimo.

The other jobs are, making firewood, which you won't need if you don't know how to properly set up the radiator of your car and suck at refueling, or smoke at the gas pump (not reccomended) pumping sewage out of sewage wells, which, much unlike wishing wells, will only fetch you the worst of diseases when jumping in them (turns out heap a titties isn't the same as hepatitis)

there's other one time jobs, but i think i've scared the living hell out of the reader by now, so this concludes the late november halloween scare for the reader, and i can move on to the next aspect of the game. the CAR that makes the title, "my summer CAR" that's right, there's a car, and if you were oblivious enough not to pay attention, the car is, in your garage, and much like my love life due to personal flaws, it's all over the place, a true tried and tested mess, and well, unlike it it can be fixed with a wrench set, lucky you.

So, the fixing car part should and technically is sort of straight forward if you know a modicum of how a fossil fuel vehicle runs, unless you're thinking of coal trains, because this baby here runs on tyres, and everyone knows trains can't fit 'cause i've never heard of a 195/65/R15 train, unless you can't read (go back up to the start of the review).Anyhow, once you get your hands on the car parts, there's most of them in the garage, except for a few which you have to buy or possibly find if you have the talented skill of omnipresence and are able to tell if Fleetari's been good or bad for this christmas.
Anyhow, when you'll fix the car, it will be almost impossible not to mess up, or give up on it, lucky you there's other methods of transportation, such as:
The clown bike, a 2 stroke maybe 1 cylinder moped, if you ever wondered what riding a chainsaw feels like it's more or less the same except with a higher risk of injury and death
The blue van, comes with 4 wheels and an engine, did i also mention the seats and steering wheel? which is more the initial car comes with, because unlike that one, this one comes pre-assembled, like your computer if you don't care about custom builds.
The rustbucket with wasps inside. That one takes a bit to unlock, but i won't be telling that, otherwise i'd be spoiling stuff, i'll tell you how to borrow it indefinitely. You can submerge the car inside of some not drinkable water, drag it out, and then use the universal masterkey known as Screwdriver, once you screwed the car good, it will get turned on, it might take a few attempts, dw, size or technique don't matter, just do your best champ and try to outlast the car, it might just take 3 seconds if you're lucky.

Then there's fleetari's car, cool i guess, comes with an american flag, and the distinct supercharger that makes you feel like you're looking through the driver's hatch of a T34, and much like a t34 driver, underestimating the situation, can and will very much make you the proud owner of a headstone with your custom social media status on it.
Honorable mentions
The Bus - this guy goes places, but i never could bother to use it
The Boat - it gets you places but it's running on fumes, silence of the lambs possibly served as a warning not to get on a boat with little to no fuel.
Your Cousin - Much like the dude from no country for old men your life's at the mercy of a coin flip, when in the car, he will make you feel like royalty, to be clear, you'll feel like Princess Diana, except you're not raring to share a passionate kiss with the finnish forestry, right? And if you're on foot, you will kiss the grill, then the bumper, then the pavement.

10/10

This game is lovely accompanied with my friends, it is pretty fun once you have built the satsuma, and also pretty fun to build and upgrade it. got pretty boring once we couldn't finish any of the rallies since our satsuma was built kinda janky, and just trying to fix anything that was wrong with it made us quit the game, but we will surely come back once we are mentally prepared for what is coming next in the game. I do recommend this game if you want to learn something new about cars and such, but keep in mind that this game is not for the weak.
Its fun, realistic, its just perfect to play it also educate us to be patience and fix things by your own (btw thats all im about to say because it alot to tell, but yeah have fun!)
i spend 15 hours before i could start the car to crash it maybe 10 minutes after, clearly my favorite game

Possibly one of the best games I have played and the most rage fueled games I have played, imagine building a car from scratch getting it rally ready heading to the starting line then your drunken cousin smashing into it and killing you in the process (permadeath).

I finally won the Amateur Rally! even though my backside was clapping at points knowing fine well another rally car could slam in to my back end instantly ending me, would recommend for sure class game.

The game is what I expected a 90's Finland simulator, in a way nostalgic and fun even that I haven't while writing this managed to get the car working I have had great time. Also I learned that Teimo doesn't like when you piss on the slot machines. Sorry for that Teimo, but it took my money! I recommend this of course if you have patience and like to do some car building. (And other random stuff of course)

this game is scarily addicting i keep hearing the engine noises in my sleep there's always something wrong and i love that this game has made me a husk of what i used to be my friends talk to me and the only thing i can think about is precious satsuma it needs fixing 

10/10 would ruin my life again

Rather then telling you my experience, here's a story

>start up the game
>fuck around with the engine until I lose my shit, sledgehammer it and look up a guide
>actually finish it surprisingly
>drive the car for 5 seconds
>piston blew up
>fleetari is closed
>outta food
>lose my save because I didn't piss for a while.

Would recommend.

easily game of the year, so frustrating to the point I want to end it, but in a good way. the map "finland" is quite large, it must be based of of someplace in real life. overall a great game to play, while drinking beer and popping fre's. must buy. 20/10.

This game is THE definition of pain, do it if you dare but basicly its rallying in a 70s care that sucks and is redicuesly hard.
Good. But official multiplayer is required! Mods working not great.

i've built this summer car several dozen times over, and perished three times as much. i haven't even entered the rally once. it's still a blast every time you build the car and it starts up perfectly after all the assembly and tuning. sisyphus has nothing on me
Driving and building the satsuma is pretty satisfying. Racing it on the other hand is extremely hard. Jobs are menial  and grinding

I‚Äôve been playing My Summer Car for several years, and it‚Äôs one of the most unique simulator-style games out there. It‚Äôs basically a real-life simulator where you build your own car from scratch, and the process is surprisingly realistic. The game doesn‚Äôt take itself too seriously, and you shouldn‚Äôt either, but that‚Äôs exactly what makes it so fun. You actually learn a lot from assembling and maintaining the car, especially since it breaks down often. On top of that, there are tons of other activities to mess around with, which keeps the game entertaining for a long time.

There are few games that hate you quite as much as My Summer Car does, but it's done in such a way that makes me want to do anything except build the car, out of a creeping dread that it just won't work. It's a fear gained from my experience, too.

negative.review: The motor crane is broken. No matter how i maneuver the engine, no matter the tricks i try, no matter the tutorials i watch. It just doesnt work.

The more time you spend playing this game the more you realize you should have left it alone. at this point in the games version, you literally need to have a full guide from start to finish, otherwise you'll make a game ending mistake that results in you having to start over from scratch to learn one of the 1,000's of game ending mistakes you can make in this game. I seriously want to enjoy this game but it makes it impossible. Only play if you have no job, no life goals, no hobbys, and want an extremly frustrating and confusing experience. Will probably log another 50 hours on this game cuz i hate it so much

steering wheels need an emulator soo if youre not interested in going through 3 programs to setup your wheel/controller then this aint the game for you. not to mention it is an unforgiving game but thats the fun of it would love to use a steering wheel but it is not supported inside the game.
Game unfortunately uses AI generated slop which has only recently been disclosed, and this wasn't disclosed when I purchased the game

Yes i checked that i am not in tool mode by pressing 2 on my keyboard. 
Yes I crouched, not leaned, 
Yes I checked my position

So when it will be fixed i will write proper review, untill then it is  unplayable
